comments:
I have an exiting Eclipse Project, built with Eclipse without any WTP. I want 
to use this project with WTP now.

When I open any JSP or XML file in this project I get an Error:
"Cannot open default editor on index.jsp. Editor could bot be initialized."

After that all saving is not possible anymore:
"Attempted to endRule: 
L/training/src/main/training/guestbook/GBController.java, does not match most 
recent begin: MultiRule[F/training/web/WEB-INF/lib].  See log for trace 
information if rule tracing is enabled."

Newly created Eclipse projects with WTP don't create errors.

stack trace of the 2nd error:

It looks like an error occurred earlier on and resulted in a rule not being
ended.    Are there any error messages or hints within your workspace's
.metadata/.log file?

It sounds like you have a re-producible case, so a few things would help. 

1. Be exact which version of Eclipse and WTP you are using together. 

2. Re-create the problem from the beginning, starting with Eclipse shutdown and
with following added to the .options file that's in the root of your Eclipse
install. 

This should produce a detailed log/console of who's acquireing the rule 
in the first place, and help us figure out why not being released correctly. 

Thanks,

# Prints debug information on running background jobs
org.eclipse.core.runtime/jobs=true
# Includes current date and time in job debug information
org.eclipse.core.runtime/jobs/timing=false
# Computes location of error on mismatched IJobManager.beginRule/endRule
org.eclipse.core.runtime/jobs/beginend=true
# Pedantic assertion checking on locks and deadlock reporting
org.eclipse.core.runtime/jobs/locks=false
# Throws an IllegalStateException when deadlock occurs
org.eclipse.core.runtime/jobs/errorondeadlock=false

I use the download bundle from the Eclipse website including Eclipse, GEF, EMF 
and WTP.

I'm not able to serialize the logs of the console window...
please give me additional advice.

If you are following the steps in comment #3, the extra debug data
should be written to the workspace's .metadata/.log file.

If seems to be written there, then yo ucould attach to this bugzilla.
Does this still occur with WTP 1.0M4?
Changed Version field given new release numbering.

Marking as verified as I know this issue is fixed (or correctly categorized).
If, as originator, you disagree or still see, please re-open, or open a new bug. 

Thanks very much for reporting and helping make WTP better.

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP defects already verified by the reporter but awaiting closure by the assignee.  If you feel this defect was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
